com.emc.esu.api

Class ListOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emc.esu.api.ListOptions

  • public class ListOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows you to specify extended options when listing directories or listing objects. When using paged directory responses (limit > 0), the token used for subsequent responses will be returned through this object.
    Since:
    1.4.1

    • Constructor Summary

        public ListOptions()

    • Method Detail

      • getLimit

        public int getLimit()
        Returns the current results limit. Zero indicates all results.
        Returns:
        the limit

      • setLimit

        public void setLimit(int limit)
        Sets the maximum number of results to fetch. Set to zero to fetch all remaining results.

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
        Returns the token used to request more results. If no more results are available, the token will be null.
        Returns:
        the token

      • setToken

        public void setToken(java.lang.String token)
        Sets the token to request more results. Normally, this will only be called internally by the API.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to set

      • isIncludeMetadata

        public boolean isIncludeMetadata()
        Returns true if metadata is included in the response.
        Returns:
        the includeMetadata

      • setIncludeMetadata

        public void setIncludeMetadata(boolean includeMetadata)
        Set to true if you want object metadata included in the response
        Parameters:
        includeMetadata - the includeMetadata to set

      • getUserMetadata

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUserMetadata()
        When includeMetadata is true, returns the requested set of user metadata values to include in the result. A null list requests all results.
        Returns:
        the userMetadata requested

      • setUserMetadata

        public void setUserMetadata(java.util.List<java.lang.String> userMetadata)
        When includeMetadata is true, sets the list of user metadata values to include in the results. Set to null to request all metadata.
        Parameters:
        userMetadata - the userMetadata to set

      • getSystemMetadata

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSystemMetadata()
        When includeMetadata is true, returns the requested set of user metadata values to include in the result. A null list requests all results.
        Returns:
        the systemMetadata requested

      • setSystemMetadata

        public void setSystemMetadata(java.util.List<java.lang.String> systemMetadata)
        When includeMetadata is true, sets the list of system metadata values to include in the results. Set to null to request all metadata.
        Parameters:
        systemMetadata - the systemMetadata to set
